metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11108 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
tcpdump 4.9.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via crafted packet data. The crash occurs in the EXTRACT_16BITS function, called from the stp_print function for the Spanning Tree Protocol.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in redhat bug report

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
